quotes.quote: The sun is the most important thing in everybody's life, whether you're a plant, an animal or a fish, and we take it for granted.
If you want to see the sunshine, you have to weather the storm.
Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
When sun shines, it not only brightens our day; it enlightens us, our soul, cleansing it of the gloominess that the night's darkness had brought in.
The sun does not shine for a few trees and flowers, but for the wide world's joy.
When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
That the sun will not rise tomorrow is no less intelligible a proposition, and implies no more contradiction, than the affirmation, that it will rise.
There is a muscular energy in sunlight corresponding to the spiritual energy of wind.
The terrible thing about sunlight is it shows the dirt.
The Sun can be your greatest gloom, or your greatest comforter, depending on how you view its shine.
Even the sun directs our gaze away from itself and to the life illumined by it.
Sunshine is Nature's hug and spirit breath to the earth.
It's a brilliant surface in that sunlight. The horizon seems quite close to you because the curvature is so much more pronounced than here on earth. It's an interesting place to be. I recommend it.
Sunlight is like the breath of life to the pomp of autumn.
We must not fear daylight just because it almost always illuminates a miserable world.
The sun lay like a friendly arm across her shoulder.
In order for the light to shine so brightly, the darkness must be present.
When the sun has set, no candle can replace it.
How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!
The day of the sun is like the day of a king. It is a promenade in the morning, a sitting on the throne at noon, a pageant in the evening.
No sun outlasts its sunset, but will rise again and bring the dawn.
The Sun is such a lonely star. Whenever he comes out to see his friends, they all disappear.
The sun burnt every day. It burnt time.
If there is nothing new under the sun, at least the sun itself is always new, always re-creating itself out of its own inexhaustible fire.
The sun would be better than a flashlight, except it doesn't work at night. It probably needs to recharge its batteries from running all day.
The sun is new each day.
A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
Sunshine is a welcome thing. It brings a lot of brightness.
